embeds.title: Fatal Desire
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
At the start of your turn, draw 2 cards and add an Injury to your hand.

messages.content:
this is good

extremely good

it's like Max Output but instead of an on-use effect it gets innate

"curses are so bad tho" stop playing deadon
one of Hermit's methods for more consistent draw
Hermit doesn't have many methods for that and so any method is valuable
works well with adapt and shadow cloak
The best Hermit card for sure, the sheer amount of card draw this gives on longer fights is insane for 1 energy
a hermit card that gets online the turn after you play it instead of in 4 turns mind blown
aside from working well so good as draw, It´s also the best curse generator Hermit has by far
It easily creates enough curses to fuel a shadow cloak block engine and It also gives the draw necessary for It to work
even outside of curse decks, the amount of draw makes up for It and covet can help exhausting some of the curses for longer fights
The upgrade is also amazing, helping you cycle through your deck faster the first time around and get your stuff online
it's basically only bad early before you have any way to use the curses/large card pile
because then you just die to not having cards because you're too slow
Even with no curse synergy this puts machine learning to shame. And that is already a strong card
even in small decks, you get to draw covet more often, I´ve never had a problem with flooding with curses with this and I almost always pick It if I don´t already have one
Unless you are 100% invested in dead on or you desperately need the other choice this is always a good choice

in terms of stuff that enables you to take this ...
high frontload so you don't die in elite fights
shadow cloak obviously
magnum
luck of the draws
adapt, malice is also good for getting you to curse parity if you can't find adapt
it depends how garbage slow your deck is pretty much
if you have this and just basics you will die to lagu
probably to sencheese
likely to nob
If you die to an elite after playing this card you were going to die even harder without it
i mean you could also have picked one of hermits many frontload attacks instead so
eh
but this is mostly relevant for act1
Seeing 2 extra cards per turn is how you find the stuff in your deck that isn't a basic
if you pick it in act2 it's usually fine
because by then you have cards

Extremely potent form of card draw, and the upgrade can be fantastic if you have something like anchor or bag of preparation to help compensate in short hallway fights. Do not pair with runic pyramid. The injuries will definitely start to overwhelm you once your first reshuffle happens, so taking final canter, adapt, or malice in order to exhaust them is helpful. You will want to have extra 0 cost cards or energy gain (eye of the storm, enervate) so that you can play all the extra cards you are drawing. Doesn’t pair well with dead-on synergies, as the injury will be added in the 3rd position in your hand, which will frequently block other cards from reaching the middle. All that being said, this is still +2 cards every turn, which will help immensely in finding your most important cards, and getting the right tools to handle what the enemies are doing each turn, so it is very powerful. Can combine with shadow cloak to get some scaling block, but only on your second cycle through the deck as the injuries are added to your hand, not drawn.

Notably hermit doesn't have many other ways to draw cards very consistently (luck of the draw is usually their best source), so the value of fatal desires effect is quite high in context. Gets better later in the run, once your deck is slightly larger, and you can delay the first reshuffle, or have found more ways to benefit from/exhaust the injuries. Upgrading it to innate is very powerful for acts 3/4 in order to get that card draw engine online consistently. Bolster rod works really well with the upgrade to create a mini anchor to protect you.
and normally hermit players have learned to not make garbage slow decks
because those tend to die
in act1

but overall the strengths of "when it's set up" do outweigh the "what if i pick it too early" mostly because you usually would have to kill a couple elites or get this from a boss reward to see it, so it's typically not too early
and people don't instazoom on rare card neow bonus
I value random rare card Neow pretty highly on Hermit, a lot of good hits, very few misses
i think the misses are mostly just stuff like <heroic>, <final canter>

embeds.title: Heroic Bravado
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Ethereal**.
Gain 1 **Rugged** :p_rugged:.
Increase the cost of this card by 2 (1) this combat.

embeds.title: Final Canter
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 0 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Retain**.
**Exhaust** all **Curse**s in hand. Deal 10 (13) damage for each. **Exhaust**.

messages.content: and bravado is like ... ok in act1
I´m happy with taking a card that is better later early on Hermit since he usually has many good frontloading options
this cards the only reason I even bother to try with curse decks. You need need need the card draw so you don't just die when you draw 3 curses and 2 strikes

fatal desire can work in non curse decks that don't use dead on, but those typically just die to the heart anyways. Its absolutely unusable with dead on which is a shame (but so are all of the other curse cards)
I do not agree, I semi-regularly take it in dead on decks. Requires <take aim> or <eternal form>

embeds.title: Take Aim
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

 **Concentrate** :p_concentration:.)
At the start of your turn, **Concentrate** :p_concentration:.

embeds.title: Eternal Form
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 3 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

​~~- **Ethereal**. -~~
First 4 playable cards drawn at the start of each turn cost 1 less that turn.

messages.content: concetrate only works once and eternal form is a 2rd rare card and after it nerf you are only lowering the cost of 4/7 cards in your hand; which makes activating dead on far more expensive
you dont need very heavy card draw as long as you have <combo> + anyways

embeds.title: Combo
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Put the first  (2) **Dead On** card (cards) triggered each turn back into your hand.

messages.content: I've made both of them work pretty consistently, maybe not well enough to beat the heart but what does beat the heart on hermit anyway
2 combos to spam dive, ghostly presence and snapshot. with as many eye of the storms you can take

blue guy has one answer to that question:
taking a fuckload of flash powders
I think a lot of flash powder gestalt could work, but like... we named 2 strategies that mostly involve multiple copies of one specific card.
also having fatal desire for too long will create to many injures for you to deal with, preventing multiple dead on procs entirely.
double determination is another one, so is double shadow cloaks. Theres a lot of plans that involve 2 or more of the same card
That is true, but hermit does have stuff to help with that, although that's more going back into the "oh just have another rare card" argument.
I don't think a deck with double determination nor double shadow cloak can beat the heart without very specific support.
In which case it's not just double determination or double shadow cloak

well ya you ideally want a few more cards in your deck. Having 2 determinations gives you 6 strength on turn 2 and 2 strength for each one of your debuff cards you play (so at least 8 strength from memento as a starting point. thats a lot of strength, playing a part in solving at least the damage side of the fight. For shadow cloaks you need curses and card draw to get your deck running imminently, hopefully you have a card like heroic bravado to survive long enough.
It´s either that, curse deck or hodgepodge of random good stuff

dead on synergies and strike and defend synergies go into the random good stuff pile, since I don´t think they are reliable enough to win on their own and rely on other random good stuff to get them through the finish line
